string.value: |I have to drive through this base to achieve my goal. Looks dangerous.
|I failed to reach the goal... Happiness was so possible, so close...
|I feel as if I know this truck. This symbol, I've seen it somewhere before...
|Of course, it's Ivan Go's car! I'll have to take a closer look.
|His body is not inside, so he walked the rest of the way.
|He's very close - but why am I afraid of what lies ahead?
|Oh my gods! What is this cursed place?
|Who are all these people?
|Now I understand what the Scientist was telling me.
|What draws these people here? What if I can still save them?
|Damn, there are so many bandits here! And more and more!
ASSISTANT|It's very dangerous here. Follow us, we will lead you out of here.
|Who are you? Anyway, I cannot defeat them all alone. Show me the way!
|I won't go anyway! They are murderers! You'd better help me defeat them!
|ASSISTANT|You cannot win, neither alone nor with our help. Follow us if you want to live.
|I'll be back to get my revenge on those murderers!
|I feel the power beckoning me to the saucer.
|Faster! How slow can this machine go! Argh, to hell with it!
|I can't stop, but it's getting harder and harder for me to walk...
|Goddamn it... I... can... n-o-t... m...o...v...e... Argh...
ASSISTANT|Let us show you the way around the military base.
|Why take a detour? I am ready to fight them. Together we will win!
ASSISTANT|Calm down. You have a mission of utmost importance and you must focus all your efforts on it.
|All right, lead the way.
HAMZA|This land is nothing like our own...
FOREIGNER|I've seen worse — we'll break through. What's the plan?
MANSUR|To look for the madmen here — isn't that exactly why we came?
HAMZA|What's the plan if we find them?
FOREIGNER|We'll figure it out as we go.
MANSUR|We won't have to hunt them down — they're already here to greet us! Attack!
MANSUR|Damn khimars! We hadn't even arrived yet, and they were already on us! Lucky we fought them off.
FOREIGNER|So they're here after all… Guess that means we're not chasing shadows.
HAMZA|Yeah, but where do we go from here?..
MANSUR|et's ride — wherever the road takes us! I'm already itching to take down these haras!
FOREIGNER|Hey, buddy, chill. Three of us? Them? Way more. Screw up once, and we're just gonna be another pair of boots feeding the dirt.
MANSUR|You're right — but I still stand by my idea. Let's just ride wherever the road takes us.
HAMZA|Looks like we don't have a choice. Let's go.
MANSUR|Not this again...
HAMZA|No way back. We stand and we fight.
FOREIGNER|Fully agree! Let's move out!
HAMZA|Mansur! What the hell?
MANSUR|It's too dangerous here! You do what you want — I'm heading back.
HAMZA|There's no escape! Ahmak! You better pray I don't come back!
FOREIGNER|Damn, how many of these bandits are there?! They just keep coming!
SCIENTIST|It's not safe here. Come on — we'll get you out.
FOREIGNER|We're not going anywhere! They're murderers! We must fight them — together!
SCIENTIST|You won't be able to defeat them even with our help. Follow us if you want to live.
HAMZA|This isn't over. We'll return, and face the shaitans once more.
FOREIGNER|Oh my gods! What is this cursed place?
FOREIGNER|Who are all these people?
FOREIGNER|Now I understand what the Scientist was telling me.
FOREIGNER|What draws these people here? What if I can still save them?
HAMZA|Not sure, but I think we'd better head back. It's getting late!
After activating the blocker and neutralizing the source of corruption, life in Vahat and across the world began to slowly return to normal.
The power of the ship, which had held so many people captive for decades, started to fade. It marked the beginning of the end of an era of madness, and the dawn of a new age of hope and healing.
Those who had once been driven mad began to return to normal lives. Their eyes no longer burned with insanity, and their faces grew calm, filled with quiet understanding.

Those who still remembered the horrors of the past tried to forget them, like a nightmare long gone. The former madmen had no memory of what they'd done under the influence of their affliction and they had no desire to remember.

Hamza and Mansur became true heroes in the eyes of their fellow countrymen. Their names were etched into history as symbols of courage and determination. Hamza's father was proud of his son and his friend, knowing that their efforts had led to the salvation of the world.

The foreigner who had aided Hamza and Mansur in their mission also became a legend. His name was spoken with respect and gratitude. He returned to Vahata to witness the fruits of his efforts and to share in the joy with his new friends.

Hamza and Mansur continued to stand by each other, helping the other residents rebuild their lives after the trauma they had endured. They knew there was still much work ahead, but now they carried the quiet confidence that no challenge was too great for them to overcome together.

Foreigner had returned to his homeland, but he remained in touch with Hamza and Mansur, offering his support and sharing his knowledge. His help proved invaluable in the world's recovery, bridging distant lands and uniting hearts long after the battle had ended.

Thanks to the courage and determination of Hamza, Mansur, and the Foreigner, the world began to heal and flourish. Their names became symbols of hope and inspiration for all who still believed in a better future.
And though the road to full recovery was long and difficult, they knew that together, they could overcome any obstacle and build a brighter tomorrow for generations to come.
Do you wish to travel to another region?
Warning!||The volume settings have been changed! If needed, check the volume settings in the game's main menu.
Mansur died.
Foreigner died.
You came too close to the Source and were consumed by its power, like so many before you. And who knows how long humanity will have to wait for a new hero...
